content.html: 67b4924
67b4924

update.description:
While working on the undo feature, I realized the state of lights is not kept on the server side.

This pull request adds `Light` and `LightState` classes to physics, so that, besides helping with undo:

* If a light is moved while recording a log file, the movement is also reproduced during playback

* Resetting the world (Ctrl + R) also resets light poses

* Having lights be a `physics::Entity` paves the way for attaching lights to links (issue #900)

Requires [SDFormat pull request #227](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/227/add-light-state/diff)
update.title: physics::Light and physics::LightState

content.html: Migration: bb4790b

content.raw:
The light part of things implemented: 8a82332.

I deprecated a subscriber to the `~/light` topic, `World::OnLightMsg` and left it printing an error message to alert users who might be publishing to this topic.
content.html:
The light part of things implemented: 8a82332.

I deprecated a subscriber to the ~/light topic, World::OnLightMsg and left it printing an error message to alert users who might be publishing to this topic.

content.raw:
also based on feedback from pull request #1895, this becomes:

~~~
return this->lightStates.find(_lightName) != this->lightStates.end();
~~~
content.html:
also based on feedback from pull request #1895, this becomes:

return this->lightStates.find(_lightName) != this->lightStates.end();

content.raw: note that I changed `gzthrow` to `gzerr` in pull request #1895 based on feedback
content.html: note that I changed gzthrow to gzerr in pull request #1895 based on feedback

content.raw: suggestion: create the `LightState` object and set these properties before inserting into `this->lightStates` to avoid mulitple lookups
content.html: suggestion: create the LightState object and set these properties before inserting into this->lightStates to avoid mulitple lookups

content.raw: Sounds good. I would vote for a `~/factory/model` topic as well, though that's outside the scope of this pull request
content.html: Sounds good. I would vote for a ~/factory/model topic as well, though that's outside the scope of this pull request

content.raw: I'm fine either way. The new topic approach is a bit easier for migration because you just need to change the topic you're publishing to, instead of creating a new message, new publisher and so on.
content.html: I'm fine either way. The new topic approach is a bit easier for migration because you just need to change the topic you're publishing to, instead of creating a new message, new publisher and so on.

content.raw: An alternative is to keep the `~/factory` topic and add optional `Model` and `Light` fields to the `factory.proto` message; not sure which is better
content.html: An alternative is to keep the ~/factory topic and add optional Model and Light fields to the factory.proto message; not sure which is better

content.raw:
I'm working on this. The plan is to deprecate `~/light` and `~/factory` topics and create 3 new topics:

* `~/factory/light` : Used to spawn lights, takes `msgs::Light`

* `~/light/modify` : Used to modify lights (pose included), takes `msgs::Light`

* `~/factory/sdf` : Keeps the old behaviour of `~/factory`, which is spawning anything from an SDF string, including lights.
content.html:
I'm working on this. The plan is to deprecate ~/light and ~/factory topics and create 3 new topics:

  • ~/factory/light : Used to spawn lights, takes msgs::Light

  • ~/light/modify : Used to modify lights (pose included), takes msgs::Light

  • ~/factory/sdf : Keeps the old behaviour of ~/factory, which is spawning anything from an SDF string, including lights.

content.raw: maybe we should change the behavior then? Perhaps adding optional Light and Model fields to the factory message so that it's easier to use `~/factory`?
content.html: maybe we should change the behavior then? Perhaps adding optional Light and Model fields to the factory message so that it's easier to use ~/factory?

content.raw: I copied from `GetModel`, but didn't investigate it properly
content.html: I copied from GetModel, but didn't investigate it properly

content.raw: I'm wondering why this accessor locks this mutex, but `GetEntity` doesn't.
content.html: I'm wondering why this accessor locks this mutex, but GetEntity doesn't.

content.raw: Can you put the implementation in the `.cc` file?
content.html: Can you put the implementation in the .cc file?

content.raw: `private`?
content.html: private?

content.raw: I see. I don't often see a private virtual function. This looks okay.
content.html: I see. I don't often see a private virtual function. This looks okay.

content.raw: But I want to override this in the Light class, the implementation in Entity is very model/link specific. Should I just use a different function name in Light and risk someone calling this on a light?
content.html: But I want to override this in the Light class, the implementation in Entity is very model/link specific. Should I just use a different function name in Light and risk someone calling this on a light?

content.raw: I think you can remove the `virtual` keyword.
content.html: I think you can remove the virtual keyword.

content.html: CI looks good
